com.itko.lisa.test

Class FilterBaseImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.itko.lisa.test.FilterBaseImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.itko.lisa.model.IWriteXML, NamedType, com.itko.lisa.test.NameGenerator, com.itko.util.test.FilterInterface, java.io.Serializable

    public abstract class FilterBaseImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements FilterInterface, com.itko.lisa.test.NameGenerator
    User: rvickers Date: Mar 27, 2006 Time: 9:56:23 PM New Base class impl to add some new functionality across Filters. All Filters should extend this class.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • PROP_PARAM

        public static final java.lang.String PROP_PARAM
        For consistency, any Filter that sets a single property, or even a "primary" property, should use this attribute to request that we know what key to store the it in. This allows the Editor to figure out what Filters are doing and users have one very small thing less to worry about.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • initialize

        public void initialize(org.w3c.dom.Element e)
                throws TestDefException
        Description copied from interface: FilterInterface
        This method is called during the construction of a Filter. Once the Filter type tag has been processed, the XML Element is passed to this method for custom XML tag processing. For example, the com.itko.lisa.FilterGetAttribute needs tag, tagn, attrib, and prop attributes parsed out
        Parameters:
        e - is the XML DOM for the Filter
        Throws:
        TestDefException - when you cannot under any circumstances work

      • gatherFilterStepConnections

        public void gatherFilterStepConnections(java.lang.String stepName,
                               ParameterList params,
                               java.util.Collection<com.itko.lisa.test.StepConnection> stepConnections)
        If this Filter might attempt to pass execution off to a specific node, return a Collection of ways that might happen.
        Parameters:
        stepName - the name of the step that owns the filter, if any.
        params - the parameters for the filter.
        stepConnections - the collection to add new step connections to.

      • getLastResponseAsDocument

        public org.w3c.dom.Document getLastResponseAsDocument(TestExec ts)
                                               throws TestRunException
        When you need access to the last node response as an XML Document, use this We cache into state the DOM so it will be parsed only once. This version will actually first check the property ability of the filter first.
        Returns:
        a Document of the last response, or an exception if it's not an HTML or XML doc
        Throws:
        TestRunException

      • isThreadSafe

        public boolean isThreadSafe()

      • setThreadSafe

        public void setThreadSafe(boolean threadSafe)
        Thread-safe filters will be allowed to execute concurrently in multi-user tests.

        By default, filters are NOT thread safe.

        If you are certain that your custom filter does not set instance variables and rely on the values being consistent across multiple threads (i.e. in a multi-user test) and instead relies purely on the TestExec state to control its behaviour and store the results then you can call setThreadSafe(true) in your constructor or initialize() and your filter will be allowed to run concurrently.

        In practice, if you use think times and have a relatively low number of vusers per JVM, the chances of a filter instance actually blocking thread A becuase thread B is executing the filter are slim.

        Not calling setThreadSafe(true) will probably not cause any performance degradation. In highly concurrent tests, having a filter which claims to be thread-safe might make a difference. Your mileage *will* vary.

        Parameters:
        threadSafe -

      • isScopeLocal

        public boolean isScopeLocal()
        This method returns a flag indicating whether the scope of this Filter is Local to the test step or not. Since this is the base class for all filters, the default is set to true. Individual asserts can override this method to return false instead.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if this filter should be allowed at test step level.

      • isScopeGlobal

        public boolean isScopeGlobal()
        This method returns a flag indicating whether the scope of this Filter is global to the entire test case or not. Since this is the base class for all filters, the default is set to true. Individual filters can override this method to return false instead.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if this filter should be allowed at test case level.
